ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Here's one for the list to answer
ygData.msgSnippet: Its not a catch 22, its a self fulfilling prophecy.  If you fix them people will play them, since they don t fix them, no one will play them.  Verant is too
ygData.messageBody:
Its not a catch 22, its a self fulfilling prophecy. If you fix them people
will play them, since they don't fix them, no one will play them. Verant is
too arrogant to realize hardly anyone wants to play them solely because they
won't fix them.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 23, 2000 5:33 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Here's one for the list to answer


From: jhenders@...

On Thu, Mar 23/00, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...> wrote:
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
> No its not that I want to complain that now they can chain cast buffs.
I'm
> more irritated in that I think there are things far more 'broken' for
other
> classes and that they should spend their time on finding way to tweak the
> non-purecasting classes to make them better as they are already behind.
Why
> on earth would Necros need any enhancement whatsoever at this point???

Like it or not, the game is now largely composed of casters, so I guess
they will be getting the most attention. It's a catch 22 really. Just
like rogues will never get "fixed" because hardly anyone plays them.
